gameDescription: In Operation Pollination, players commandeer advanced airships in a near future where the survival of bees and the global ecosystem is at stake. The game combines strategic decision-making with environmental conservation, focusing on the crucial role bees play in our world.

blueTeam.name: The Apis Aviators
blueTeam.description: Specialized in restoration of natural habitats and the creation of new ones.

redTeam.name: The Bombus Navigators
redTeam.description: Experts in ecological technology and societal interface.

turns.scenario: Post-Hurricane Recovery: Teams face the aftermath of a massive hurricane affecting bee populations and their habitats.

options.A: Plant native flowers in hurricane-affected areas to restore bee habitats.
options.B: Establish new bee colonies in safe zones, ensuring their survival post-disaster.

AA.narrative: Both teams focus on nature regrowth, planting vast swaths of native flowers. As these bloom, they bring back displaced bees, creating a vibrant post-disaster recovery.

AB.narrative: The Aviators plant flowers while the Navigators establish new colonies. This combined effort results in a balanced recovery, helping both existing and new bee populations.

BA.narrative: The Navigators plant flowers while the Aviators establish colonies. Together, they manage to accelerate the recovery process, ensuring that both habitats and bee populations get a boost.

BB.narrative: Both teams establish new colonies, spreading them across safe zones in a well-coordinated mission. Bees population starts to recover significantly post-disaster.

turns.scenario: Wildfire Restoration: Teams tackle the aftermath of devastating wildfires affecting bee habitats.

options.A: Seed fire-ravaged areas with bee-friendly vegetation to encourage ecological recovery.
options.B: Create artificial bee habitats in unaffected regions to support displaced populations.

AA.narrative: Both teams cover fire-ravaged areas with bee-friendly seeds. As new life sprouts, it revives not only the landscape and bees, but also other wildlife, creating a ripple effect of recovery.

AB.narrative: The Aviators seed fire-ravaged areas while the Navigators create artificial bee habitats. The combination of efforts leads to quicker healing of the land and efficient assistance to displaced bees.

BA.narrative: The Navigators sow seeds while the Aviators create habitats. This results in new, healthier ecosystems that support not only bees but also other species, benefiting the entire local biodiversity.

BB.narrative: Both teams create artificial bee habitats, providing immediate sanctuary for displaced bees. Soon enough, these areas buzz with life, as colonies proliferate in the new homes.

turns.scenario: Sustainable Expansion: Teams have the opportunity to advance bee conservation with forward-thinking initiatives.

options.A: Develop bee sanctuaries with advanced ecological technology for optimal habitat conditions.
options.B: Launch educational campaigns to promote bee conservation and awareness.

AA.narrative: Both teams elect to develop bee sanctuaries, utilizing advanced technology to offer optimal conditions. These sanctuaries become model projects and scientific research bases, offering insight into bee behavior and conservation.

AB.narrative: The Aviators establish high-tech bee sanctuaries, while the Navigators launch impactful educational campaigns. The fusion of actions causes a bee conservation wave, influencing both policy makers and the public.

BA.narrative: The Navigators create advanced sanctuaries, and the Aviators run educational campaigns. The conjunction of initiatives steers social change towards environmental responsibility, supported by scientific evidence from the sanctuaries.

BB.narrative: Both teams launch impactful educational campaigns. These efforts lead to policy changes and increased public awareness, generating a progressive social environment favoring bee conservation.
